title: Matt Braaksma
text: I am a PhD student in Applied Economics at the University of Minnesota. I am interested in applied microeconomic research with a focus on environmental and natural resource economics, sustainable development, land use economics, economic issues of Indigenous communities, and spatial analysis. Specifically, I am currently working on research involving ecosystem services, economic development, efficient land use, and property rights. I am currently an active member of the NatCap TEEMs and I formerly worked as a Student Research Associate at the Center for Health Economics and Policy Studies (CHEPS) at San Diego State University. I completed my MA in Economics at San Diego State University and my BA in Business Administration at Eastern Washington University.

title: Matt Braaksma
text: I am a PhD student in Applied Economics at the University of Minnesota. I am interested in applied microeconomic research with a focus on environmental and natural resource economics, sustainable development, land use economics, economic issues of Indigenous communities, and spatial analysis. title: Curriculum Vitae
text:
email: braak014@umn.edu | website: https://m-braaksma.github.io/



RESEARCH INTERESTS
Environment and Resource Economics | Land Use Economics | Development Economics | Applied Spatial Analysis | Economic Issues of Indigenous Communities



EDUCATION
Doctor of Philosophy – Applied Economics  University of Minnesota Aug 2022 — Present

Master of Arts – Economics  San Diego State University Aug 2020 — May 2022

Bachelor of Arts – Business Administration  Eastern Washington University Sept 2013 — June 2017

Minors in Economics and Visual Communication Design 





CURRENT RESEARCH EXPERIENCE

Research Assistant
Department of Applied Economics, University of Minnesota June 2024 – Present
Supervised by Dr. Justin Johnson

Developed “A Framework for Measuring African Ecosystem Services Impacts from Land-Related Policies” with collaborators from the European Commission Joint Research Centre, and Wageningen University & Research.
Contributed to the development of an integrated modeling framework combining a computable general equilibrium (CGE) model with spatially explicit ecosystem service models to evaluate the economic and ecological consequences of land use change in Kenya, with a focus on policy goals related to carbon storage, pollination services, and spatially targeted restoration and protection.
Utilized Python and geospatial tools (SEALS, InVEST) to simulate land allocations, analyze ecosystem service outcomes, and assess policy impacts aligned with Kenya’s climate and biodiversity goals.



Member, NatCap TEEMs (The Earth-Economy Modelers)
Natural Capital Project, University of Minnesota August 2022 – Present
Led by Nfamara Dampha (Research Center Director), Justin Johnson (PI), and Stephen Polasky (PI)

Contribute to collaborative research improving Earth-Economy models that integrate ecological, climate, and economic data.
Support efforts to align economic systems with environmental stewardship to inform sustainable development policy.





PREDOCTORAL RESEARCH EXPERIENCE

Student Research Associate
Center for Health Economics and Policy Studies, San Diego State University Sept 2020 – Aug 2022
Supervised by Dr. Joseph Sabia (Director) and Dr. Yang Liang (Co-director)


Research Assistant
Department of Economics, San Diego State University Sept 2020 – Aug 2022
Supervised by Dr. Kangoh Lee and Dr. Jacob Penglase

“Can Anti-Vaping Policies Curb Drinking Externalities? Evidence from E-Cigarette Taxation and Traffic Fatalities”, with Dhaval Dave, Yang Liang, Catherine Maclean, and Joseph Sabia. No. w30670. National Bureau of Economic Research, 2022.
